Articles.Content: Welp, discuss kerbalkon I guess.
I can't wait! Is it going to be a physical event? It should be....
I have no idea what to expect from Kerbalkon. I see it when it's there...

I have my only 2 college final exams starting at 8:00am on the 13'th

figures.

Does anyone know where I could view a recorded stream of the event?

I missed the previous ones. I have no idea what to expect beyond some live streams. I imagine most everything is going down on twitch but don't know if I'll be needing to watch the forums, twitter, tumbler, facebook... so on and so forth to get everything.

It'd be nice if there was one central place where everything KKON related was and all their other communication channels were just posting links to it.
I am predicting "soonÃ¢â€žÂ¢" will be about then
Well, it it's anything like KerbalKon last year, they will tease you for practically two days straight showing off 0.23, and at the very end, more than likely release it.

I can't wait! Is it going to be a physical event? It should be....

It will be a streaming event.
I really hope they don't hold back the release of .23 intentionally to have some sparkles and flash for Kerbalkon.

I doubt they're holding back.

It's gonna release on kerbalkon I bet. I was doubtful last time, but 0.18 brought HAPPINESS AND BUNNIES!

I doubt they're holding back.

It's gonna release on kerbalkon I bet. I was doubtful last time, but 0.18 brought HAPPINESS AND BUNNIES!

I remember watching that kerbalkon, they were gonna stream all night and they all got tired and released .18 like 10pm cst.

I actually expect .23 to be out before K-KON. KerbalKON is too long...

But hey Maxmaps and who ever sees this before him... K-KON is less than a week away... There should be a schedule of some sort posted... soon... and not soon tm... but more like today and Monday at the latest. I'm not trying to be demanding here. That's not the tone I wish to convey. I've run a convention before. We had the schedule pretty much nailed down and posted up on our website about 2 weeks before the event. It wasn't the biggest convention ever but it was fun running it. So I'm just trying to give a little advice here. Today's Dev stream would be the perfect time to put up the schedule.

Edited December 6, 2013 by FITorion

I am a bit worried about starting my next mission right now, I have finals next week and will only be doing limited playing. I would hate to be in the middle of interstellar space and in the update something has moved. On the other hand this will be my first Kerbalkon I get to see as I only recently found out about the game, and I am excited to hear what is coming up next.
